intro: Anneslia leucotricha, commonly known as the white-haired anneslia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it its common name. Anneslia leucotricha is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
